portabout.para: NetBSD/alpha is a true 64-bit system that fully implements the LP64 architecture, using 64-bit pointers and 64-bit long integers (standard integers are still 32 bits) in a linear four terabyte (4TB) address space. NetBSD/alpha was the first free OS to run on the Alpha and supports by far the largest number of alpha system types of any free OS.

NetBSD runs on almost all of the existing alpha systems, including some of the more unusual ones with proprietary or legacy bus architectures, such as the large-scale 8400, all of the TURBOchannel systems, the 4100 series, and the EISA-only Jensen.
Easily installed binary distributions of NetBSD/alpha are available for the 2.0 release and for snapshots of NetBSD-current.

portinfo.portml: NetBSD's port to Digital's Alpha (64-bit) machines

portnews.portnewsitem: NetBSD 3.0 has been released with support for 57 architectures. More information is available in the 3.0 release announcement.

NetBSD 2.1, the first maintenance release of the netbsd-2 release branch, has been released with binary distributions for 48 architectures. More information is available in the 2.1 release announcement.
&a.garbled; has uploaded binary packages for NetBSD-2.0/alpha from the pkgsrc-2005Q2 branch into .
NetBSD 2.0 released with support for 48 architectures. More information is available in the 2.0 release announcement.
NetBSD 1.6.2 released with support for 40 architectures. More information is available in the 1.6.2 release announcement.
NetBSD 1.6.1 released with support for 40 architectures. More information is available in the 1.6.1 release announcement.
NetBSD 1.6 released with support for 39 architectures. More information is available in the 1.6 release announcement.

portsection.title: Supported System Models
portsection.para: Systems for which support was added in NetBSD 1.4 are marked (1.4). Systems for which support was added in NetBSD 1.5 are marked (1.5).

itemizedlist.listitem: 264DP, XP1000, DS10, DS20, API UP2000, UP2000+ and other Tsunami-based EV6 systems (1.4D, 1.4.1)
API UP1000 and UP1100 (AMD 751-based) EV6 systems (1.4Z, 1.5)
Digital AXPpci systems (including UDB and Multia)
EB64+-family systems (including Digital EB64+ and third-party AlphaPC 64 systems)
EB164-family systems (including Digital EB164 and third-party AlphaPC 164 systems) (support (1.4) for some models)
